• 3 lb 90% lean ground beef
  • 1 cup onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic minced
  • 1 1/4 cup ketchup
  • 1 cup red bell pepper, chopped
  • 5 Tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
  • 1/4 cup pack brown sugar
  • 3 Tablespoons vinegar
  • 3 Tablespoons mustard
  • 2 teaspoons chili powder

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Brown ground beef, onion, and garlic.
  2. Drain pan of grease.
  3. Combine ingredients into a crockpot.
  4. Stir in beef mixture.
  5. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
  6. Spoon onto hamburger buns.
  7. Maybe, add a playful pickle

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 ½ lb. flank steak or sirloin
  • ½ cup fresh lime juice
  • 2 Tbsp red wine vinegar
  • 3 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed
  • 1 Tbsp ground cumin
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 1 jalapeno, seeded and chopped
  • 2 tsp oregano leaf
  • 1 medium onion, minced
  • ¼ cup oil
  • ¼ cup chopped cilantro
  • 16 green onions, cleaned.
  • Tortillas
  • Pico de Gallo
  • Guacamole

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Combine lime, vinegar, garlic, cumin, salt, pepper, jalapeno, oregano, onion, cilantro and 2 T of oil in a blender or food processor, blend until smooth.
  2. In a shallow baking dish, pour mixture over flank steak-coat both sides.
  3. Let marinate at room temp for 4 hours, turning a few times.
  4. Preheat grill (charcoal, gas or may be done on stove in hot skillet)
  5. Place meat on grill about 6 inches above coals, grill to medium rare or desired temp, about 12 min.
  6. Transfer meat to tray and cover lightly with foil and let stand for 10 min before carving.
  7. Meanwhile, brush green onions with remaining oil and grill until browned and wilted, about 3-4 min. Transfer to a serving platter.
  8. Slice flanks very thick across the grain on the bias.
  9. Serve with warm tortillas, pico de gallo and guacamole.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb smoked sausage sliced
  • 1 cup chopped onions
  • 1 cup chopped apples
  • 1 cup chopped broccoli

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Brown the sausage and onions.
  2. Add the chopped apples and brocolli halfway through browning.
  3. Add packet of Ranch dressing and 1/2 cup sour cream
  4. Serve over favorite pasta.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups coocked chicken breasts
  • 1/2 can milk (Milnot)
  • 2 cups cooked rice (uncle Ben’s converted)
  • 2 teaspoons lemon juice
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1, 8 oz can water chestnuts, sliced
  • 3 hard boiled eggs, sliced
  • 1 can cream of chicken soup
  • 1 cup mayonaise (not miracle whip)
  • 1 Tablespoon grated onion

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Mix above ingredients.
  2. Grease a large casserole dish.
  3. Place mixed ingredients
  4. Top with 1/2 cup slivered almonds
  5. Cover with a 3/4 stick of buterr Rice Krispies absorbed.
  6. Bake at 350 degrees Farenheit for 30 mins.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 small onion, peeled chopped fine
  • 2 garlic cloves, peeled and chopped
  • 1 medium red bell pepper, chopped fine
  • 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces
  • 3 15 oz can undrained white beans
  • 4 oz canned green chiles, diced
  • ½ tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp chili powder
  • 1 can chicken broth (14.5 oz)
  • 2 Tbsp lime juice
  • 2 Tbsp cilantro
  • 6 Tbsp salsa
  • ½ cup heavy cream

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. In a heavy large pot heat oil, add onion, red pepper, and garlic. Saute for 5 minutes
  2. Push onions to one side and sauté chicken for approximately 5 minutes.
  3. Stir in the white beans, chiles, cumin chili powder, and broth.
  4. Bring to boil and reduce the heat.  Simmer for 10 minutes.
  5. Stir in chicken broth and simmer for 5 minutes.
  6. Stir in lime juice, cilantro, and cream.
  7. Garnish with a tablespoon of salsa if desired.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bunch green onions, chopped, white, and green
  • 2 large onions, diced
  • ½ cup olive oil
  • 1 cup soy sauce
  • ½ cup red wine vinegar
  • ½ cup brown sugar
  • ½ cup Jamaican Jerk Seasoning (Five Star if you can get it or any other good quality seasoning)
  • ½ tsp cayenne pepper

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Combine all ingredients in a solid bottom saucepan.
  2. Bring to boil, reduce to simmer for 15 mins.
  3. Cool
  4. Use as a marinade, or brushing glaze for jerk cooking

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Very good on Chilean sea bass, fresh halibut, most white fleshy fishes.
  • Marinate for a couple of hours with that type of fish.
  • Meatier fish as tuna, swordfish, marinate up to 4 hours
  • Pork is awesome.. up to 8 hours of marinating time.
  • Brush while cooking
  • Serve with grilled pineapple

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3/4 cup avocado oil
  • 2 egg yolks (room temperature)
  • 1 egg white
  • 1 Tablespoon white wine vinegar
  • 1 Tablespoon apple cider vinegar
  • 1 Tablespoon fresh squeezed lemon juice
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • ⅛ teaspoon white pepper
  • 1 teaspoon yellow mustard
  • ¼ teaspoon sweet paprika (not smoked)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Add 2 large room temperature egg yolks into the pint Mason jar
  2. Carefully add in the vinegars, lemon juice, salt, mustard,  and paprika.
  3. Add in the Avocado oil very slowly, being careful not to disturb the yolks.
  4. Put immersion blender into the bottom of the jar and blend on high until the bottom starts to turn white. Once it does keep immersion blender on and slowly pull immersion blender towards the top or tilt slightly to pull oil down into emulsion.
  5. Slowly pull up and all contents of the jar should turn white. My Duke's mayo is done!

First video

https://youtu.be/ILAQ_x5rM2U?si=dTqSbuDXOcOIPNS-

Version 2

https://youtu.be/0qUy4dXgD0Q?si=C_1UU6qm7rlFEdP4

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1/2 cup basil, chopped
  • 1/4 cup toasted pistachios, chopped (can use pine nuts)
  • 1 Tablespoon EVOO
  • 1 Tablespoon of grated parmesan
  • 2 Tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Mix ingredients together.
  2. Add parmesan and salt to taste.
  3. Service over vegetables or as an easy dip!

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs tomatillo, hulled and cut in half
  • 2 yellow onion, peeled and quartered
  • 3-5 jalapeno
  • Chicken stock to cover (2-3 quarts)
  • 2 bunches fresh cilantro.
  • Juice of 3 limes
  • Oil for frying
  • Salt and pepper to taste

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Combine tomatillos, onion, jalapeno, and chicken stock in a large pot.
  2. Bring to boil, simmer for 30-45 minutes until stock is reduced and tomatillos are very soft.
  3. Take off heat and set aside to cool.
  4. When cool, in batches, in a blender add lukewarm mixture (not hot!! It will blow up on you) lime juice and cilantro.
  5. Blend until very smooth. Continue until everything is blended together.  Mix thoroughly.
  6. THE NEXT STEP IS VERY IMPORTANT.. IT WILL MAKE A MESS, AND IS HOT.  DO IT IN SMALL BATCHES.
  7. In a medium skillet.  Add 2 T of vegetable oil and heat to almost smoking hot.  In small amounts add the tomatillo mixture and FRY the liquid stirring using a flat wooden spoon or rubber scraper.
  8. Fry for 3-5 minutes until mixture becomes thicker and changes color slightly and the oil is totally incorporated.  Do not burn it.
  9. Continue with the rest of the mixture cleaning pan if needed and using more oil for each batch.
  10. Serve with Tacos, chips, enchiladas, tamales.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup mixed hot dried red Chile peppers (such as arbol, ancho or new mexico)
  • 2 teaspoon salt
  • 10 clove garlic, peeled
  • 1 ½ teaspoon cumin seed
  • 1 teaspoon coriander seed
  • 1 teaspoon caraway seed
  • 1 teaspoon dried mint leaf
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • 3 Tablespoons + extra-virgin olive oil

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Place peppers in bowl, cover with boiling water.  Let sit for 20 min, or until softened
  2. Place cumin, coriander and caraway seed in small skillet. Toast over medium flame, constantly swirling pant until fragrant. About 4-5 min.
  3. Transfer spices to a grinder with the dried mint and grind to a fine powder.  Set aside
  4. Drain peppers and place in food processor with spices, garlic, salt, lemon and olive oil.
  5. Puree, stopping occasionally to scrape down sides, until a fine smooth paste is formed. About 2 min.
  6. Place paste in sterilized glass jar.
  7. fill jar with enough extra-virgin olive oil to submerge paste.
  8. Refrigerate.  Mix well before use.  Cover remaining with oil and refrigerate
  9. Use in soups, stews on meats or sandwiches.. just about anything.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb ground beef
  • 1 lb ground sausage
  • 1 medium onion chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic minced
  • 1 large can diced tomatoes
  • 1 large can tomato sauce
  • 2 heaping teaspoons tomato paste
  • Oregano
  • Mixed seasoning badiya or Italian seasoning
  • Thyme
  • 2 dashes Worcestershire

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Cook meat in pan.
  2. Sauté onion in tsp oil.
  3. Add garlic when onion is almost done.
  4. Add tomatoes, sauce and paste.
  5. Bring to a simmer.
  6. Add spices.
  7. Add meats to sauce and simmer.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 teaspoon Garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon Onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon Oregano
  • 1 teaspoon Black pepper
  • 4 Tablespoon Chili powder
  • 1 Tablespoon Paprika
  • 1 Tablespoon Salt
  • 2 Tablespoons Cumin

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients together!

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 small zucchini (4 cups sliced)
  • 2 teaspoons kosher salt
  • 2 Tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 yellow onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 green onion
  • 1 cup heavy whipping cream
  • 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
  • ¼ cup parmesan cheese, shredded
  • ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 ½ cups crumbled fresh mozzarella cheese (can also use shredded)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
  2. Prepare the zucchini:
    1. Remove the top and bottom, and slice it thin.
    2. Place the zucchini slices in a large tray covered with a clean tea towel or paper towel.
    3. Sprinkle some salt on top so they’ll release excess water.
    4. Leave it for 10-15 minutes, and then repeat it on the other side.
    5. Dry the zucchini using a clean towel.
    6. Take a 9’’ round baking pan, and arrange ⅓ -¼ of the zucchini slices on the base. Set aside.
  3. Add two tablespoons of olive oil into a skillet and sauté onion and garlic until fragrant (about 2 minutes). Add sliced green onion (the white part only) and stir until the onion is translucent.
  4. To the skillet, over medium heat, add heavy cream, cheddar, and parmesan cheese; mix until smooth and slightly thickened. Remove from heat.
  5. Season cheese mixture with ground black pepper, and add beaten eggs. Whisk to combine.
  6. Cover the zucchini slices with creamy sauce and mozzarella cheese. Repeat two to three more layers with the rest of the zucchini, the sauce, and mozzarella cheese.
  7. Bake this zucchini casserole for 20 minutes or until zucchini is fork-tender. Serve warm.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 49.5 oz can of chicken broth
  • 2 lbs frozen hash browns
  • 1 can cream of chicken soup
  • 8 oz of cream cheese

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. In a crock pot, combine the chicken broth, hash browns, and cream of chicken soup.
  2. Set crock pot on low for 5 hours.
  3. Put cream cheese in the soup and stir until blended.
  4. Cook for another hour.
  5. Serve soup topped with cheese and bacon.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 cloves garlic, minced
  • 6 Tbsp veg oil
  • 3 russet potatoes, scrubbed and cut into 12 wedges
  • 2 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 1 ½ tsp salt
  • ¾ tsp pepper
  • ½ tsp garlic powder.

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Adjust oven rack to lowest position and heat oven to 475˚ F.
  2. Combine garlic and olive oil in a large mixing bowl and microwave until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute.
  3. Transfer 5 Tbsp of oil only to a rimmed baking sheet. Coat entire sheet
  4. Add potatoes to bowl and toss to coat. Wrap tightly with plastic wrap and microwave for 3-6 minutes until potatoes are translucent.
  5. Shake bowl halfway through cooking to recoat potatoes
  6. Combine cornstarch, garlic, salt and pepper in a small bowl.  Sprinkle over hot potatoes, toss to coat.
  7. Arrange potatoes on a prepared baking sheet in a single layer.
  8. Bake, turning once until deep golden brown and crisp, about 30-40 minutes.

docs.title: Salad
docs.text:
• 1 yellow pepper, chopped
  • 1 orange pepper, chopped
  • 1 red pepper, chopped
  • 1/2 medium red onion, chopped
  • 2 cucumbers, chopped
  • 1/4 - 1/2 cup kalamata olives
  • Cherry tomatoes, halved
  • Large chunk of feta (cut in cubes or crumbled)

docs.title: Dressing
docs.text:
• 1/2 c olive oil
  • Little less than 1/4 c of red wine vinegar
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Greek seasoning if you have it!

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Combine salad ingredients together in a large bowl.
  2. In a separate dish, combine dressing ingredients.
  3. When dressing is mixed, add to the salad.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 egg yolks
  • 2 whole eggs
  • 2 Tbsp cold water
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp cream or vegetable oil
  • 4 cups sifted flour
  • ½ tsp baking powder

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Excluding the flour and baking powder, beat all the ingredients together
  2. When mixed well, add flour and baking powder to make a stiff dough.
  3. Divide into 5-6 balls.
  4. Roll each into desired thickness.
  5. Fold the dough and slice it into any width you prefer.
  6. Leave on a floured board overnight to dry.
  7. After covering with a clean dish towel, pack into glass jars or plastic bags and store in a deep freezer.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 1/2 lb Italian Sausage (1 lb regular and 1/2 lb hot)
  • 1 whole onion, chopped
  • 4 cups beef broth
  • 1 /12 cup water
  • 12 ounce can tomato sauce
  • 3 cup carrots, sliced
  • 2 1/2 cups yellow squash, diced
  • 2 bell peppers, diced
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon dried basil
  • 8 ounces cheese ravioli, cut into halves

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Brown sausage and drain.
  2. In a pot, add the drain sausage, onion, beef broth, tomato sauce, carrots, squash, bell peppers, oregano, and basil.
  3. Cook for the 30 mins
  4. Add the ravioli and cook for 30 mins.
  5. Serve with parmesan on top of soup.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1-2 Tablespoon Canola oil
  • 1 large onion, diced
  • 3 garlic cloves, minced (or 1/2 tsp garlix powder)
  • 1 lb chicken breasts or rottiserie chicken, cooked
  • 2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 jalapeno pepper (remove seeds if you do not like spicier foods)
  • 6 cups chicken broth
  • 1 (14.5 oz) can fire roasted diced tomatoes with chilis
  • cilantro

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. In a large pot, cook the chicken.
  2. While cooking, prepare your jalapeno.
  3. Add your chicken broth to the pot.
  4. Add ingredients.
  5. Serve with avocado slices, mexican cheese, sour cream, and fritos.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 28 oz Frozen Turnip Greens'
  • 8oz bacon
  • 6 spring onions
  • 1 Tbsp Salt (preferably free range)
  • 1/2 Tbsp Pepper
  • 1/2 Tbsp Garlic Powder
  • 1 tsp Cayenne

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Cook kosher certified pork bacon over medium high heat or in oven at 400 degrees until bacon is crispy (15-20 mins).
  2. Add bacon to pot along with greens and spices, covering with gluten free water.
  3. Boil this for 3 mins and then let simmer for 10 mins or until desired texture is achieved.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1/2 lb chopped bacon
  • 2 lb beef, cubed
  • 6 large cloves crushed garlic
  • 1/2 lb sausage
  • 6 stalks of celery
  • Half head of cauliflower
  • 1 large onion
  • 6-7 carrots
  • 2 15 oz cans diced tomatoes
  • 1 28 oz can crushed tomatoes
  • 1 box organic chicken broth
  • 1 Tablespoon chicken bouillon
  • 1 cup Barley and/or wild rice

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Brown together the bacon, beef, garlic, and sausage.
  2. While browning, chop and set aside the following:
    1. Celery
    2. Cauliflower
    3. Onion
    4. Carrots
  3. Add diced tomatoes, crushed tomatoes, chicken broth, and chicken bouillon to browned meat.
  4. Add veggies after a 5-10 mins.
  5. Bring to boil
  6. Add Barley and/or wild rice
  7. Bring to boil again then simmer for 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb Italian Sausage
  • 1 leek diced (white only) or 1 small onion
  • 4-5 red potatoes diced in larger pieces
  • 1 box and 1 large can of chicken broth
  • 5-6 large kale leaves
  • ¼ to ½ cup butter
  • 2 Tbsp flour
  • 2 packages dry original ranch dressing
  • 1 ¾ cup half and half

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Brown sausage with the leek or onion.
  2. Boil potatoes in the chicken broth.
  3. Add kale after potatoes are done.
  4. In a saucepan make a white sauce with butter, flour, and ranch dressing.
  5. Add half and half.
  6. Bring to boil and continue boiling for two minutes.
  7. Add to sausage and broth mixture, stirring for 1-2 minutes.
  8. Simmer for 15-20 minutes and turn on low.
  9. Soup can be served immediately or refrigerate after it cools.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs hamburger
  • 1 can of pinto beans
  • 1 can kidney beans
  • 1 can of black beans
  • 2 cans diced tomatoes
  • 2 cans Ro-Tel tomatoes
  • 1 package ranch dressing (dry)
  • 1 package taco seasoning
  • 1 can white corn
  • 1 can green chilies
  • Onion

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Brown hamburger in a large pot
  2. Add all ingredients and stir
  3. Simmer on low heat until done.
  4. Garnish when serving with sour cream, green onions, grated cheese, and corn chips

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb Brussel Sprouts
  • 1/2 lb bacon
  • 6 Tbsp Gochujang
  • 2 Tbsp Bachan’s Japanese Barbecue Sauce

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 400 F.
  2. Partially, cook the bacon - get it about 60% done as it will be going in the oven
  3. While the bacon is cooking, wash and halve the Brussel sprouts
  4. In a bowl, mix the 3 Tbsp Gochujang and 1 Tbsp Barbecue sauce together - adjust to your liking.
  5. Add half the Brussel Sprouts to the bowl and mix with the sauce.
  6. On a large baking pan, place the Brussel Sprouts mixture.
  7. Repeat steps 3-5 with the remaining Brussel Sprouts.
  8. When the bacon is finished, place it on a cutting board and chop it into bits. Keep some of the grease.
  9. Spread bacon (and grease) on top of the baking pan
  10. Bake for 40 mins.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 small packages frozen strawberries or raspberries (ensure they are frozen hard)
  • 2 small packages strawberry jello
  • 1 1/2 cup hot water
  • 2 bananas, mashed
  • 1 small can crushed pineapple, well-drained
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 2-3 Tbsp lemon juice
  • Knox Gelatin (just a little)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Mix jello and hot water
  2. Chop frozen berries into large chunks and add to jello.
  3. Stir until all the ice is melted.
  4. Add lemon juice and Knox Gelatin
  5. Add banana and pineapple
  6. Pour half of this mixture into a pan or mold.
  7. Daub the sour cream over this.
  8. Pour the remainder of the jello mixture on top of the sour cream.
  9. This begins to set almost before you are through with the mixing

docs.title: Sweet and Sour, Cabbage, and Barley Soup
Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1-2 tsp oil
  • 1 lb stew beef
  • 1 large onion
  • 4 cup water or chicken broth
  • 1 small cabbage, sliced
  • 1 large carrot, sliced
  • 1/3 cup barley
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1/2 tsp pepper
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp powdered mustard
  • 1/2 tsp poultry seasoning
  • 3 Tbsp brown sugar
  • 3 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
  • 1 can (32 oz) tomatoes with juice or 8 tomatoes quartered

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Brown stew meat.
  2. Add the remaining ingredients and bring the mixture to a simmer for 45-60 minutes.
  3. Add more pepper, salt, brown sugar, or lemon juice to your taste.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Rotisserie chicken
  • 3 cups water
  • 2 jars of salsa (whatever kind you like)
  • 1 bag of frozen corn
  • 1 can cannelloni beans
  • 1 can low-fat chicken broth
  • Salt and pepper to taste

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Pull all the meet off of the rotisserie chicken.
  2. In a crock pot, combine all the ingredients.
  3. Heat on high for 1 hour or for 10 contiguous minutes of boiling.
  4. Place temperature on low.
  5. Serve with cheese, tortilla chips or Fritos, sour cream, avocado, or anything else you like.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• ¾ cup canola oil
  • ¼ cup lemon juice
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • ½ tsp salt
  • ½ tsp pepper
  • 2 lbs Romaine lettuce, torn
  • 2 cup chopped tomatoes
  • 1 cup shredded Swiss cheese
  • ⅔ cup slivered toasted almonds
  • ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese
  • 8 slices bacon, crumbled
  • 1 cup Caesar Salad croutons

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. In a jar with a tight lid, combine oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
  2. Cover and shake well.
  3. Chill.
  4. In a serving bowl, toss lettuce, tomatoes, Swiss cheese, almonds, Parmesan cheese, and bacon.
  5. Shake dressing and pour over salad.
  6. Mix the salad.
  7. Add croutons and serve immediately.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Large Onion, chopped
  • 6 cloves Garlic, crushed
  • 1 1/2 cup Celery, chopped
  • 1-2 lb Cubed beef (small)
  • Olive oil
  • 1 quart Chicken Stock
  • 6-7 Cubed Potatoes
  • 2 large cans diced tomatoes
  • 1 1/2 cup Carrots
  • (Other vegetables to taste)
  • 1 cup Barley
  • Bay leaf
  • Salt & pepper
  • Rosemary (opt)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Sauté with olive oil the chopped onion, garlic, celery, and cubed beef.
  2. Add chicken stock, cubed potatoes, diced tomatoes, and carrots.
  3. Bring to a light boil then add barley.
  4. Reduce heat after 10-15 mins.
  5. Season with bay leaf, salt and pepper, and rosemary.
  6. Cook on low for 40 mins.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups cooked wild rice
  • ½ cup craisin
  • 1 small can sliced water chestnuts
  • ½ lb fresh mushroom, sliced
  • 2 ribs celery, diced
  • 1 bunch green onion, diced.
  • 1 red pepper, diced fine.
  • 2 Tbsp fresh parsley, chopped.
  • ¼ cup grated carrot
  • ½ cup or more Marzetti’s Raspberry dressing.
  • 2 Tbsp red wine vinegar

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Combine all salad ingredients.  Mix well
  2. Add dressing until just coated.
  3. Stir in vinegar.
  4. Cover and chill for 1 hour.
  5. Stir before serving.  Add more dressing if needed.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1/2 cup wild rice
  • 1 lb bacon
  • 3 Tbsp bacon drippings
  • 3/4 cup celery, chopped
  • 1 cup onion, chopped
  • 1/3 cup chopped green pepper
  • 2, 14.5 oz cans (ready to serve) chicken broth
  • 4 oz can mushrooms
  • 3, 10.75 oz cans cream of mushroom soup, undiluted

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Wash wild rice.
  2. Boil rice for 15 minutes and drain. Set aside.
  3. Fry bacon until crisp.
  4. Remove bacon and discard all but 3 Tbsp bacon drippings. Sauté celery, onion, and green pepper in the drippings.
  5. Cook until the onion is transparent.
  6. Put in a large kettle and rice, broth, mushrooms, soup, and dice bacon.
  7. Cook on low heat for 1 hour or more.
